alert.note: Alert for Bartow (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 05 at 11:36PM EDT until April 06 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Etowah River near Cartersville affecting Bartow County. For the Etowah River Basin...including Dawsonville, Landrum, Etowah River at GA 9 near Dawsonville, Dawsonville, Dawsonville, Barrettsville, Free Home, Northeast Canton, Ball Ground, East Canton Downstream I-575, Canton, Waleska, Woodstock, Big Shanty/Kennesaw, Blackwells, Woodstock, Kennesaw, Mars Hill, Etowah River at Allatoona Dam above Cartersville, Cartersville, Rockmart, Dallas, Kingston, Kingston, Rome GA 1 Loop, Etowah River at Coosa Valley Fairgrounds at Rome...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Etowah River near Cartersville. * WHEN...Until late Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18 feet, Flood Stage is reached. Minor flooding develops as flood waters reach through backyards of homes right up to homes on Riverside Court Southeast. Farmland and farm building floods downstream of Old River Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 17.6 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 18.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 18 feet. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
